intro: Taraxacum japonicum, commonly known as Japanese dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves and a hollow, leafless stem that supports a single, yellow flower head. The plant is native to East Asia, including Japan, Korea, and China, and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It produces a capsule containing numerous seeds with white, feathery pappi that aid in wind dispersal. The plant is often found in gardens and disturbed areas, and it has been introduced to other parts of the world as an ornamental and medicinal species.
